item.title: I Write Type Safe Generic Data Structures in C
item.description: I write type safe generic data structures in C using a technique that I haven‚Äôt seen elsewhere1. It uses unions to associate type information with a generic data structure, but we‚Äôll get to that. My approach works for any type of data structure: maps, arrays, binary trees‚Ä¶ but for this article I illustrate the ideas by implementing a basic linked list. Since many people aren‚Äôt aware you can do C generics at all, I figured I‚Äôd start simple and build up to this:
